show.title: The Ultimate Willy Wonka Party
show.headline: Scrumdiddlyumptious

event.title: <show-title>The Ultimate Willy Wonka Party</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See Willy Wonka with Mike Teevee and Veruca Salt in person!
event.description:
Come with me, and you'll be in a wooorld of pure imagination...and you'll also be in a theater with two of the original kids from WILLY WONKA & THE CHOCOLATE FACTORY! We'll have a full Q&A after the screening, so you can ask Paris Themmen (Mike TeeVee) what it was like to be so tiny and ask Julie Dawn Cole (Veruca Salt) what happened after she got dumped down the Bad Egg chute.

Plus, are you a Wonka fanatic? Dress as your favorite character, set piece, or prop from the film and compete in our scrumdiddlyumptious gummy bear eating contest!

Whether you're a kid or just a kid at heart, this candy-colored movie is a delightful confection that you'll enjoy again and again. And for this screening, we're pulling out all the stops with custom chocolate bars (of course!), golden goose feathers, and a whole lot more. We'd hate to ruin it all for you, so sign the contract on the bottom line and enter the magical world of Willy Wonka…

eventType.title: Live Q&A
eventType.headline: Exclusive conversations with actors and filmmakers
eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero Live QA 1920x1080

titleCardImage.altText: Live QA TC

show.title: The Mummy (1999)
show.headline: The sands will rise. The heavens will part. The power will be unleashed.

event.title: <show-title>The Mummy (1999)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Presented by Super Yaki
event.description:
This show is presented with our friends over at Super Yaki, an indie apparel company that has become a cinephile favorite according to Entertainment Weekly. They rule the internet.

We have a soft spot for 1999’s THE MUMMY, with its thrilling action sequences, sweeping romance, goofy sense of humor, exotic locales, and, of course, the pure, unbridled star power of Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. So we’re inviting you to journey with us to Hamunaptra as we celebrate one of our favorite pieces of ’90s popcorn cinema with THE MUMMY Movie Party.

An ancient curse. A supernatural monster. A bumbling librarian. A dude who definitely isn’t Indiana Jones. Join us for a night of grand, old-fashioned adventure.

show.title: Mean Girls
show.headline: So Fetch!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried, and Lacey Chabert in Mean Girls

portraitHeroImage.altText: Rachel McAdams and Lacey Chabert in Mean Girls

event.title: <show-title>Mean Girls</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: This party's gonna be so fetch
event.description:
There's a Regina George in every high school in America. That's precisely why MEAN GIRLS is so relatable, and also why it's so important. Comedic goddess Tina Fey based the screenplay on a non-fiction book about the social patterns of teenage girls and then harvested those authentic situations for priceless nuggets of hilarity.

This movie is funny because it's true to life, although the cast, including Fey, Rachel McAdams, Lizzy Caplan, Amy Poehler, and Lindsay Lohan (in the best role of her career), definitely had something to do with it. It's a portrayal of teen politics so accurate that it should be required viewing in every school across America. And given the stellar cast and hilarious script, it's easy to see why this movie so quickly earned a permanent place in our cultural lexicon, not to mention our everyday vocabulary.

It's packed with great quotes, from the elegantly simple, "Boo, you whore," to Damian's trademark, "YOU GO, GLEN COCO!", and at these interactive shows, you can celebrate all of these lines and more. Plus, we'll be handing out themed props, because the limit on fun at these screenings does not exist.

It's a night guaranteed to be even better than a cake made out of rainbows and smiles, so whether you're a Plastic, a Mathlete, or a Badass M.C., prepare yourself for a totally grool time.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Clue
show.headline: Seven suspects, six weapons, five bodies, and three endings

event.title: <show-title>Clue</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Mr. Boddy personally invites you to a killer party
event.description:
A mysterious invitation brings six strangers to a secluded mansion for an unconventional dinner party where each guest receives a pseudonym. As they learn more about their host, Mr. Boddy (Lee Ving, FLASHDANCE), via his butler, Wadsworth (Tim Curry, THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW), the group quickly realizes that Boddy has a devious plan in mind for all of them. And that’s when people start to die.

With a cast of comedy heavyweights including Madeline Kahn (YOUNG FRANKENSTEIN), Christopher Lloyd (BACK TO THE FUTURE), and Michael McKean (THIS IS SPINAL TAP), CLUE turns the classic, stuffy murder mystery on its head. Jam-packed with physical comedy, goofy puns, sexual innuendo, and twist upon twist upon twist, the film is a hilarious showcase for some of the best comic actors who ever lived.

And because this is a Movie Party, we’ll provide you with fun props and all sorts of blunt objects (that you didn't realize were weapons until your mom had to explain that you can actually kill anyone with basically anything) so that you can get in on all the murderous mayhem (note: please don’t murder anybody). You’ll have so much fun, you’ll feel fl-flame-flames! On the side of your face!

event.title: <show-title>Cassandro</show-title> <event-type-title>Advance Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: See the larger-than-life story of Cassandro early, for free
event.description: Do you think Cassandro would wait until release day to see this high-flying biopic? No! He would jump off the high rope and take down anyone in his way to see it early – luckily you can just reserve your seat and see it for free. Join us for a free screening of CASSANDRO and all you have to do to secure your seat is purchase a small food & beverage voucher that you can redeem for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks during the show.

eventType.title: Free Victory Screening
eventType.headline: Our way of saying thank you to our Victory Members
eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We’re saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Menu TC3

show.title: Thelma & Louise
show.headline: Somebody said get a life... so they did

event.title: <show-title>Thelma & Louise</show-title>
event.headline: "Let's not get caught! Let's keep going!"
event.description:
In this writer’s humble opinion, both Geena Davis and Susan Sarandon are incapable of making “straight” films. From THE LONG KISS GOODNIGHT to THE HUNGER to BEETLEJUICE, and hell, even STEPMOM, these acting icons make films that are intrinsically queer. THELMA & LOUISE, from director Ridley Scott and writer Callie Khouri, is one of the queerest “straight” films out there. Thelma (Davis) and Louise (Sarandon) are two best friends on a weekend road trip to escape their dreary and unsatisfying lives in Arkansas. When Thelma is sexually assaulted in the parking lot of a roadhouse, Louise intervenes, fatally shooting the attacker. The two flee the scene, headed to Mexico, knowing that in a “man’s world,” their experiences would not be believed or understood. Featuring a stellar supporting cast including Michael Madsen, Harvey Keitel, and Brad Pitt (in one of his first major acting roles) THELMA & LOUISE is a classic piece of feminist cinema and a damn good time at the movies. Davis and Sarandon both deliver Oscar-nominated performances as the hapless gal pals on the run from the law. The intimate chemistry and sexual tension between the pair are palpable; throughout the film, we just keep shouting, “Forget about these damn men and be together!” A monument to female friendship, solidarity, and risking it all for the person you love most in the world, THELMA & LOUISE is a must-see film, especially if you’ve never seen it. (Micheal Foulk)

4k DCP courtesy of Park Circus.

show.title: Road House
show.headline: It's a dirty job, but somebody's gotta do it

show.title: Spartacus (1960)
show.headline: I am Spartacus!

show.title: Attack the Block
show.headline: Inner City vs. Outer Space

event.title: <show-title>Attack the Block</show-title>
event.headline: The best monster movie of the past decade? Believe it.
event.description:
We're excited to be bringing back the greatest sci-fi triumph of the last decade to the big screen! Featuring an intergalactic hero (the STAR WARS Sequel Trilogy's John Boyega) and the new Doctor Who (Jodie Whittaker).

Guy Fawkes Night in London is a time for fireworks, fooling around and an occasional surprise or two. But when vicious extraterrestrials decide to crash the hellraisers’ holiday in ATTACK THE BLOCK, a time for making merry quickly turns scary. This frisky, vigorous spoof (propelled by an insistent electronic score by Steven Price & Basement Jaxx) shows a similar sensibility in its breezy blending of goofiness and gruesomeness.

Don't worry if you don't understand every word of the mash-up of patois, Cockney slang and hip-hop terms spoken by the younger characters: A good scream (or a good laugh) sounds the same in any language.

35mm print courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

show.title: Carnival of Souls
show.headline: The ground-breaking surrealist chiller

event.title: <show-title>Carnival of Souls</show-title>
event.headline: The ground-breaking surrealist chiller
event.description:
Very few regional horror movies are strong enough to be considered miracles. But CARNIVAL OF SOULS is a miracle beyond miracles. After a mysterious car accident, Mary (Candace Hilligoss) takes a job as a church organist. Subsequently, she finds herself tormented by a mysterious ghoul...and his undead friends. Shot in Lawrence, Kansas, and at Utah's majestic Saltair Pavilion by industrial filmmaker Herk Harvey, CARNIVAL OF SOULS is like nothing else on the planet. With its stunning black and white photography and ghostly organ score, this eerie, thoughtful dreamscape influenced everything from George Romero’s NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD to David Lynch’s ERASERHEAD. Prepare to have your skeleton rattled. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

DCP courtesy of Janus Films

show.title: Drag Me to Hell
show.headline: Even nice people can go to hell

event.title: <show-title>Drag Me to Hell</show-title>
event.headline: Even nice people can go to hell
event.description: Christine Brown is a loan officer at a bank but is worried about her lot in life. She's in competition with a competent colleague for an assistant manager position and isn't too sure about her status with her boyfriend. Worried that her boss will think less of her if she shows weakness, she refuses a time extension on a loan to an old woman, Mrs. Ganush, who now faces foreclosure and the loss of her house. In retaliation, the old woman places a curse on her which, she subsequently learns, will result in her being taken to hell in a few days time. With the help of a psychic, she tries to rid herself of the demon, but faces several hurdles in the attempt.

show.title: Opera
show.headline: 4K restoration of Argento’s brilliant giallo

event.title: <show-title>Opera</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of Argento’s brilliant giallo
event.description:
There’s nothing else like OPERA. After the artistic highs (and box office lows) of TENEBRE and PHENEMONA, Dario Argento (SUSPIRIA) was on a mission to make the most accomplished giallo of his career. And that’s exactly what he did. OPERA follows Betty, the star of an avant-garde performance of MACBETH, as she deals with a black-gloved maniac on a mutilation spree at a theater. With its ultra-stylized photography, complex metaphors, and intense violence, OPERA is a brilliantly deranged spectacle – and the most breathtaking horror experience of 1987.

Content Warning: This movie contains a brief scene of violence against birds.

Screening the 4K restoration from Severin Films

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Saw
show.headline: An infectious anxiety attack

event.title: <show-title>Saw</show-title>
event.headline: An infectious anxiety attack
event.description:
Forget everything you know about “torture porn” and accept SAW for what it is: a taut horror-thriller that has more in common with Hitchcock than Slipknot. Lawrence (Cary Elwes) and Adam (co-writer Leigh Whannell) are two strangers who awaken in a dungeon-like room with no memory of how they arrived. Soon enough, they discover that they’re trapped in a game led by a serial killer named Jigsaw. The debut feature from James Wan (THE CONJURING), SAW is an intense exercise in design that toes the line between gross-out violence and delicious camp—much like a Playstation 2 survival horror game. If that’s not enough, this movie also stars the incomparable Danny Glover.

Screening an archival 35mm print

show.title: The Wicker Man: The Final Cut
show.headline: The definitive version of Robin Hardy's thriller

posterImages.altText: THE WICKER MAN: The Final Cut 50th anniversary

event.title: <show-title>The Wicker Man: The Final Cut</show-title>
event.headline: The definitive version of Robin Hardy's thriller
event.description:
The final cut is the definitive version of Robin Hardy's thriller of pagan worshippers on a remote Scottish island. Seen for decades only in mutilated copies, the StudioCanal restoration is the culmination of a long search for the complete director's cut.

After receiving an anonymous note about a missing child, Sgt. Howie arrives on the remote Summerisle only to be met with evasive townspeople who claim the child does not exist. Attempting to chase down clues, Howie catches on to the pagan culture that prevails – couples have sex publicly, children learn about phallic symbols – all things that deeply offend the devoutly Christian Howie. Those acts seem far less severe once a series of photographs brings him to the conclusion that children are being sacrificed for the island's harvest, and he is even more determined to find the missing child whom he believes is up next for the fast-approaching May Day festival.

4k DCP courtesy of Rialto Pictures

show.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
show.headline: Once...they made history. Now...they are history.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Bill and teds bogus journey hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: Bill and teds bogus journey hero

event.title: <show-title>Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey</show-title>
event.headline: Once...they made history. Now...they are history.
event.description: After a time travel-aided history presentation created Bill S. Preston, Esq. and Ted Theodore Logan's sonic utopia, everything should've been fine, right? Would-be despot De Nomolos has another idea: send a pair of evil doppelganger robots to kill our heroic duo before they can win their battle of the bands! A wyld adventure that astral projects our head-banging heroes through Heaven & Hell, BOGUS JOURNEY stands as one of the rare sequels that equals (and to some, surpasses) the original. STATION!

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Cecil B. Demented
show.headline: John Waters' Y2K trash manifesto

event.title: <show-title>Cecil B. Demented</show-title>
event.headline: John Waters' Y2K trash manifesto
event.description:
“We ain’t got no budget,” goes a line in the tongue-in-cheek hip-hop theme song to Waters’ freewheeling attack on the Hollywood star system. Stephen Dorff and Melanie Griffith star as, respectively, the leader of a guerrilla band of horny misfit filmmakers (the Sprocket Holes) and the A-list Hollywood star they kidnap and coerce – Patty Hearst–style – into a string of terrorist activities. (Hearst, in fact, had a cameo in the film, her fourth for Waters.) With its awards-show abduction scene, its passages of movie-theater mayhem, and its bloody penultimate sequence – a shootout on the set of a FORREST GUMP sequel – CECIL B. DEMENTED is Waters’ most extreme and sustained attempt to bite the hand that once fed him. (Film at Lincoln Center)

35mm print courtesy of Lionsgate

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Double Team
show.headline: Dennis Rodman and Jean-Claude Van Damme vs. Everyone!

event.title: <show-title>Double Team</show-title>
event.headline: Dennis Rodman and Jean-Claude Van Damme vs. Everyone!
event.description: In the year of 1997 a massive dimensional rift opened up, and the world as we know it was exposed to an alternate universe much more fantastic than the one we call home. That can be the only explanation for the existence of legendary Hong Kong director Tsui Hark's glorious DOUBLE TEAM. Counter-terrorist agent Jack Quinn (Jean-Claude Van Damme) is careening through Europe, searching for the infamous terrorist Stavros (Mickey Rourke) who has kidnapped Quinn's pregnant wife. Sound like typical '90s action stuff? Throw in Dennis Rodman as Van Damme's eccentric weapons dealer named Yaz who sports a wardrobe of outfits that would make David Bowie blush and speaks almost entirely in basketball puns. With a script from the writer of LIFEFORCE and ARACHNOPHOBIA, DOUBLE TEAM is a slam dunk! (Tiernan O'Rourke)

eventType.title: Special Event

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Impulse (1974)
show.headline: Captain Kirk like you've never seen him before, unless a teleporter is involved

event.title: <show-title>Impulse (1974)</show-title>
event.headline: Captain Kirk like you've never seen him before, unless a teleporter is involved
event.description:
One of the most shocking and demented thrillers of the 1970s, IMPULSE features William Shatner as Matt Stone, a deranged gigolo who preys on rich women, unable to control his murderous psychosexual urges. Directed by legendary exploitation filmmaker William Grefé (THE DEATH CURSE OF TARTU), and co-starring Jennifer Bishop (Al Adamson's THE FEMALE BUNCH), Ruth Roman (Hitchcock's STRANGERS ON A TRAIN), Harold "Oddjob" Sakata (GOLDFINGER) and William Kerwin (Herschell Gordon Lewis' BLOOD FEAST). IMPULSE is being presented in a beautiful new master lovingly restored in 4K from rare archival 35mm film elements.

DCP courtesy of Grindhouse Releasing

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Resident Evil: Retribution
show.headline: The ultimate battle begins

event.title: <show-title>Resident Evil: Retribution</show-title>
event.headline: Pure kinetic action mayhem in three dimensions
event.description:
"Its 96 minutes are so utterly bugfucking absurd that RETRIBUTION remains one of the only movies I get giddy just thinking about." – Morgan Hyde, Hyperreal Film Club

"Anderson not only creates electric, vivid action sequences, he specifically makes them as visually cohesive as possible to ensure you can see EVERYTHING happening in them." – Trace Sauveur, Letterboxd

How many other movie series reach their peak five in? The first RESIDENT EVIL movie, already a departure from the video game series, created a whole new mythos surrounding the evil Umbrella Corporation and their tinkering with genetics and creation of the T-virus that led to a zombie apocalypse. Five movies in, the series has long abandoned its zombie-laden survival horror roots and is, more than anything, a playground for Milla Jovovich and her director husband Paul WS Anderson to play. And play they do as Jovovich flips around through a series of fantastic artificial spaces, forward and backward in time, and in and out of layers of reality. You don't have to have seen any of the previous films to appreciate this maximalist video game masterpiece (I promise!). (Laird Jimenez)

3D DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Dark Backward
show.headline: You gotta hand it to him...

event.title: <show-title>The Dark Backward</show-title>
event.headline: You gotta hand it to him...
event.description:
Existing in a universe covered in filth and neon glow, THE DARK BACKWARD is an unclassifiable gem of oddness written and directed by Adam Rifkin (DETROIT ROCK CITY). The movie stars Judd Nelson as the slouching, nervous Marty and Bill Paxton as the overly enthusiastic, accordion playing Gus, friends who work as garbage men but are looking to break into show business. Marty has been trying out his stand up comedy, mousily addressing an indifferent audience, drenched in sweat. Things take a turn when he suddenly grows a fully working arm out of his back, catching the eye of a sleazy talent agent (played by Wayne Newton!) With a truly bizarre performance from Nelson, THE DARK BACKWARD has grown in cult status over the decades since its release. (Cristina Cacioppo)

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Tokyo Pop
show.headline: A woman spontaneously moves to Japan to become a rock star

event.title: <show-title>Tokyo Pop</show-title>
event.headline: Recently rediscovered and totally rad.
event.description:
Bleach-blonde rocker Wendy (Carrie Hamilton) is disillusioned with her life in New York City. After receiving a postcard from Japan saying “wish you were here,” she spontaneously hops on a plane to Tokyo with dreams of making it big as a singer. Quickly finding herself broke and lost in translation, she moves into a youth hostel for gaijin (foreigners) and takes up work as a hostess at a karaoke bar. Just when she’s at her breaking point, she meets Hiro (Diamond Yukai), a rock ‘n’ roller whose band is looking for their big break. They form a romantic and musical connection and Hiro convinces Wendy to become their lead singer. Through a combination of hustle and luck, they stumble into their 15 minutes of fame, but Wendy soon comes to realize that being a gaijin rocker may be nothing more than a passing fad. She begins to question where her future lies and whether she will hold her bandmates back if she stays.

4k DCP courtesy of Kino Lorber.

show.title: Pride & Prejudice (2005)
show.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without

event.title: <show-title>Pride & Prejudice (2005)</show-title>
event.headline: Swoon over Mr. Darcy while you sip on some champagne
event.description:
What more does anyone need than the brooding, handsome Mr. Darcy? Well, Pemberley doesn't hurt. Nor do the fancy balls and gorgeous dresses and romantic intrigue and...yep, Elizabeth Bennet is one lucky (and most deserving) lady.

You may be one of those purists who only watches the BBC version (which is, admittedly, a masterpiece). If so, just remember the point of this story: it's not good to be prideful OR prejudiced! Give Joe Wright's version a chance, and within minutes, you'll be enchanted by breathtaking cinematography, lively humor, simmering passion, and Matthew Macfadyen as Mr. Darcy. Yes, that’s Tom from Succession. Yes, he’s totally swoon-worthy. A nice glass of champagne helps too, so we'll have plenty of bubbly available to order.

show.title: Scanners
show.headline: David Cronenberg made the best X-Men movie you’ll ever see.

event.title: <show-title>Scanners</show-title>
event.headline: David Cronenberg’s stylized nightmare is the best X-Men movie you’ll ever see.
event.description: Made between THE BROOD and VIDEODROME, SCANNERS finds filmmaker David Cronenberg at an aesthetic peak. In a plot straight out of a bronze age X-Men comic, a man with unstoppable telepathic powers finds himself locked in battle between the government and other “scanners” that are set on world domination. This gruesome and stylized film was Cronenberg’s breakout hit in the U.S., and it solidified his trademark melding of the visceral and the cerebral.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

Children ages 6+ admitted after 6pm.
All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

queues.queueMessage: …Ready For It? It's time to get in line. Once you join you'll be able to purchase tickets when it's your turn, and in the meantime feel free to browse available seats for TAYLOR SWIFT | THE ERAS TOUR. Thanks for your patience.
queues.activeMessage: We know All Too Well how hard waiting can be, TAYLOR SWIFT | THE ERAS TOUR tickets are in high demand. Thanks for sticking with us.
queues.eventMessage: We know All Too Well how hard waiting can be, but TAYLOR SWIFT | THE ERAS TOUR tickets are in high demand. We will begin forming a virtual line for tickets at noon local.
